title: Album cover fonts
content:
Here are two images posted by number3pencils on the Album cover meme thread - I’m wondering what this font is. He doesn’t have contact activated for me to ask him directly.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080604063229im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Untitled_4571_3550.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080604063229im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/huancavelica_3675_4165.png)

 [‹ (x) casual handwritten script - Brisa {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080604063229/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40768 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Manplan frustration - Neil Bold {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080604063229/http:/www.typophile.com/node/9314 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pattyfab

comments.content:
This ought to be something from Stephen’s list of freehand serifs (sorry I don’t have the link). Another thought is Ingrimayne Types by Robert Schenk. I will go look through those.

- Mike Yanega

A number of Schenk’s fonts are teasingly similar. For example, see [Anarckhie](http://web.archive.org/web/20080604063229/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/anarckhie/).

- Mike Yanega

Nathanael (number3pencils) already answered this on the album thread, but I’ll repeat the answer here for the sake of reference. The font is his own creation Newt, former called Salamander. The light weight is used here. Newt is yet to be released (arrangements are being made with Veer according to Nathanael), but you can follow its development in the [Typophile critique section](http://web.archive.org/web/20080604063229/http:/typophile.com/Salamander).
